discourse_list.title: Delegate Office Hours #2 - Includes poll for discussion topic

content.content: Delegate Office Hours  Info Thursdays, 4PM - 5PM UTC Join Zoom Meeting https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88286550832?pwd=dWQzQi9tYlNyemJJS2Nrd2NUdTBoZz09 Meeting Information Meeting ID: 882 8655 0832 Passcode: 690611  Weekly Topic Poll    This Week’s Discussion Topic  MakerDAO Constitution Upcoming Budget proposals The “LOVE” drama Active Core Unit Offboarding Proposals No Topic, Open Mic Other, provide suggestion     0 voters     Subscribe to the Calls Calendar for easier access to call information
I expect to have a counter-proposal ready that lowers ISCU’s monthly burn in place of off-boarding. A temperature check for our counter-proposal would be greatly appreciated.
How much reduction is it?

Currently our minimum spend is 22k per month. We propose to take that down to 8k. The full proposal will present the rationale and what will be cut. It’s basically an extension of what we already suggested in our June update.
What is the purpose of this weekly call?
Same as any office hours – lets anyone join and ask questions. I suppose it’s also for delegates to engage with each other around a topic.
I see value in it and I’d like to participate but I can’t be there at that time weekly. Would be great to be able to have some input into future scheduling.

there will never be a perfect slot for everybody. the slot was picked because I and others (cannot recall everybody, so not listing anyone) took the initiative and actually made something happen. we decided on the slot, here it is. i would very much prefer a slot that would be even worse for americas people (for most of the calls - living in europe sucks if you need to deal with US-timezones) - but having this just before the G&R call will have the additional benefit of bringing us all to talking mode so maybe G&R can be a bit more engaging as well. there is a nice german proverb called “wer schreibt, der bleibt” - cannot find a good translation, but maybe you get the twist
Yes man, just saying that it would be nice to be able to participate with the other delegates. I’ll develop my own office hours in the meantime at my own time.

good luck, i tried that once 8 months ago - was a total failure. but i heard @ACREinvest has made some better results. the big upside of having this as a group is that the formerly secret 1on1s i had with other delegates can now happen in public. which - i guess - is a good thing?
Disregard my vote, it was a clumsy move of my stupid thumb. (…) Nevermind. Do not disregard my thumb’s vote. That’s a spicy, interesting, topic to discuss.
psychonaut:  Currently our minimum spend is 22k per month. We propose to take that down to 8k.   I think we can probably avoid offboarding if this is true.
Man, this must have been the shortest Poll I’ve ever seen. It closed in less than 24 hours kek
Couldn’t make the call but enjoyed the recording!  Are these going to be weekly?
pretty sure we will continue from here on (yes, weekly)

content.content: Delegate Office Hours Info Thursdays, 4PM - 5PM UTC Join Zoom https://us02web.zoom.us/j/88286550832?pwd=dWQzQi9tYlNyemJJS2Nrd2NUdTBoZz09  Meeting Information Meeting ID: 882 8655 0832 Passcode: 690611 Weekly Topic Poll    This Week’s Discussion Topic  More on MakerDAO Constitution Aave GHO stablecoin implications Setting MakerDAO Priorities How to Promote Vault Usage Upcoming Budget Proposals No Topic, Open Mic Other, Provide Suggestions     0 voters     Subscribe to the Calls Calendar for easier access to call information Thank you

I suppose this could be couched under MakerDAO priorities, but I’d like to have a specific open discussion on the strategic approach to real world assets. We’ve been having a lot of this conversation in the DVC and Discord, so would be great to be able to discuss it with the delegates in here.

Hey Thomas, thanks for proactively publishing this poll. I feel that RWF is really the elephant in the room, and we definitely need some time to talk about that.
There isn’t much new to discuss though. Unless someone has concrete new information or a specific proposal they want to put forward, the discussion would just be a rehash of the last two weeks.
Why don’t we start with where in the world is @Real-World-Finance ? They’ve been Missing In Action since I last seen a TV show called The Sopranos
